conversation.content: Um, so I'm looking at your tree service package TSP-9902 and, uh, there's something really wrong here.
Oh! Um, okay so let me just—wait, let me pull that up—TSP-9902, um, right right, I've got it here. So, uh, what seems to be the—I mean, er, what's concerning you about it?
Says you top trees. For health. That's not—that kills them.

Oh. Oh um. So I'm—let me just, uh, double check this description here because, um, I want to make sure I'm reading this correctly. It says, er, "crown topping for optimal tree health" under service code SVC-4481-B?
Right. That's backwards. Um, topping, uh, it causes decay, weak growth. Like, massive stress response.
Okay so—hmm, this is—I'm not the tree expert here but, um, you're saying this is actually, er, harmful? Let me just—I need to flag this, reference number REF-77234-QM.
Twenty years certified. It's harmful. Very.
Right. Right okay. So um, between you and me? I think—no wait—I think someone in marketing, uh, really messed this up. Let me, er, get incident report INC-9958-KL started here.
Um, also says, uh, "fertilize in late fall." That's, um, that encourages growth before frost. Bad idea.
Oh man. Okay so—I'm just—wow. Um, documenting that too under, uh, the same incident. So you're—you're actually an arborist? Like, er, professionally?
ISA certified. Your whole program's wrong.
This is—okay I'm, um, actually really glad you called because, er, this could've been bad. So your account, uh, ACC-5847-TN9, I'm adding expert consultant notes.
Can someone fix it? Before you—before people actually book this?
Yes! Um, absolutely. So I'm—let me just—I'm escalating this to, er, product team right now with priority flag PRI-HIGH-8823. They should, uh, pull it offline within, hmm, thirty minutes?
Good. Um, the pruning schedule's wrong too. Says, uh, spring for oaks.
Spring for—oh no. That's, um, that's not right either is it? I'm just—wow we really, er, botched this entire thing. Adding that to case CSE-10947-RX.
Oak wilt season. Never spring. Ever.
Got it. Never spring. So, um, look—I'm gonna, uh, put you down as technical reviewer if that's okay? Reference code REV-6623-LP. Maybe we can, er, prevent this next time?
Sure. Yeah. That'd—that'd actually help.
Perfect! So, um, I've got everything documented under master ticket MST-8874-QQM and, uh, honestly? Between us? You probably just, er, saved us from a bunch of lawsuits. So, um, thank you.
